rawConfiguration.text:
# Ingest Overview
The data provided in this tab are taken from the NrConsumption dashboard and should directly correlate to the data shown in the Usage UI. It is provided here for easy reference and also for trend analysis and additional customization for your specific use case.
After identifying the top contributors to data ingest, navigate to the tab specific to that data category to dive deeper into the sources of data ingest and identify potential optimization opportunities.

widgets.title: Total Data Ingest (1 wk) vs. 1 Month Ago

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM NrConsumption 
SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE productLine = 'DataPlatform'
 AND (version = '0.4.2' OR nr.customerStructure='customer_contract') 
 AND consumingAccountId = 0
SINCE 8 days ago 
UNTIL 1 day ago 
COMPARE WITH 1 month ago

FROM NrConsumption 
SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE productLine = 'DataPlatform'
 AND (version = '0.4.2' OR nr.customerStructure='customer_contract') 
 AND consumingAccountId = 0
FACET usageMetric
SINCE 8 days ago
UNTIL 1 day ago
TIMESERIES

FROM NrConsumption 
SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE productLine = 'DataPlatform'
 AND (version = '0.4.2' OR nr.customerStructure='customer_contract') 
 AND consumingAccountId = 0 
FACET usageMetric
SINCE 1 week ago 
UNTIL now
LIMIT MAX

widgets.title: Total Data Ingest (1 day) vs. 1 Week Ago

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM NrConsumption 
SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE productLine = 'DataPlatform'
 AND (version = '0.4.2' OR nr.customerStructure='customer_contract') 
 AND consumingAccountId = 0 
SINCE 2 days ago 
UNTIL 1 day ago
COMPARE WITH 1 week ago

widgets.title: Total Data Ingest by Product (1 day) vs. 1 week Ago

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM NrConsumption 
SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE productLine = 'DataPlatform'
 AND (version = '0.4.2' OR nr.customerStructure='customer_contract') 
 AND consumingAccountId = 0 
FACET usageMetric
SINCE 2 days ago 
UNTIL 1 day ago
COMPARE WITH 1 week ago
LIMIT MAX

rawConfiguration.text:
# Note on Metric ingest
Only raw metrics are billable. To query only raw metrics, the query timeframe has to be less than 1h. This is why most of the widgets on this page has a query timeframe of 59 minutes. The daily ingest is then simply extrapolated over 24h to give you an idea of the daily ingest.

# Dimensional Metrics
New Relic automatically rolls up event data into key performance metrics that can be efficiently queried for up to 13 months. New Relic does not charge for storage of those metrics. In addition, there are a number of metrics available for querying in the database that are used for troubleshooting or internal uses that are not billable (e.g. any metrics matching the expression: ```newrelic.*```).

Dimensional metrics can be optimized via either drop rules or through agent configurations.

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Metric 
SELECT ((bytecountestimate()/1e9) / 59 * (60 * 24)) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source != 'agent' OR newrelic.source IS NULL
 AND metricName NOT LIKE 'newrelic.%' 
SINCE 59 minutes ago

FROM Metric 
SELECT ((bytecountestimate()/1e9) / 59 * (60 * 24)) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source != 'agent' OR newrelic.source IS NULL
 AND metricName NOT LIKE 'newrelic.%'  
FACET 
 if(instrumentation.name is not null, instrumentation.name, metricName), 
 if(instrumentation.source is not null, instrumentation.source)
SINCE 1 day ago
TIMESERIES
LIMIT 100

WITH aparse(metricName, '*_*') AS (type, rest)
FROM Metric 
SELECT ((bytecountestimate()/1e9) / 59 * (60 * 24)) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source != 'agent' OR newrelic.source IS NULL
 AND metricName NOT LIKE 'newrelic.%' 
FACET metricName
SINCE 59 minutes ago
LIMIT 100

widgets.title: Ingest Estimate by Instrumentation Provider and Name (1 day)

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM `Metric` 
SELECT ((bytecountestimate()/1e9) / 59 * (60 * 24)) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source != 'agent' OR newrelic.source IS NULL
 AND metricName NOT LIKE 'newrelic.%' 
FACET instrumentation.provider, instrumentation.name 
SINCE 59 minutes ago 
LIMIT max

widgets.title: Ingest Estimate by Entity Name (1 day)

nrqlQueries.query:
WITH aparse(metricName, '*_*') as (type, rest) 
FROM Metric 
SELECT ((bytecountestimate()/1e9) / 59 * (60 * 24)) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source != 'agent' OR newrelic.source IS NULL
 AND metricName NOT LIKE 'newrelic.%' 
FACET entity.name 
SINCE 59 minutes ago 
LIMIT max

widgets.title: Ingest Estimate by Metric Type (1 day)

nrqlQueries.query:
WITH capture(metricName, r'(?P<type>[A-Za-z]*)(_|\.).*') AS (type) 
FROM Metric 
SELECT ((bytecountestimate()/1e9) / 59 * (60 * 24)) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source != 'agent' OR newrelic.source IS NULL
 AND metricName NOT LIKE 'newrelic.%' 
FACET type 
SINCE 59 minutes ago 
LIMIT max

widgets.title: Ingest Estimate by Metric Type and Name (1 day)

nrqlQueries.query:
WITH capture(metricName, r'(?P<type>[A-Za-z]*)(_|\.).*') AS (type), 
 capture(metricName, r'([A-Za-z]*)(_|\.)(?P<name>[A-Za-z]*)(_|\.).*') AS (name) 
FROM Metric 
SELECT ((bytecountestimate()/1e9) / 59 * (60 * 24)) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source != 'agent' OR newrelic.source IS NULL
 AND metricName NOT LIKE 'newrelic.%' 
FACET type, name 
SINCE 59 minutes ago 
LIMIT max

rawConfiguration.text:
# Timeslice Metrics
These metrics are pulled automatically by our agents and provide from automatic aggregations to reduce data size, as this data is also available for 13 months. This data is, by default, not aggreegated across applications, which can prove inefficient in single-tenant environments where many individual instances of the same application are running in parallel.  

This data type can only be optimized by using metric normalization rules.

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Metric 
SELECT ((bytecountestimate()/1e9) / 59 * (60 * 24)) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source = 'agent' 
SINCE 59 minutes ago

FROM Metric 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 10e08 AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source = 'agent'
FACET `appName` 
SINCE 1 day ago
TIMESERIES 
LIMIT 100

FROM Metric 
SELECT ((bytecountestimate()/1e9) / 59 * (60 * 24)) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source = 'agent'
FACET agent.type 
WHERE newrelic.source = 'agent'

FROM Metric 
SELECT ((bytecountestimate()/1e9) / 59 * (60 * 24)) AS 'GB Ingest' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider != 'kentik'
 AND instrumentation.provider != 'pixie'
 AND newrelic.source = 'agent'
FACET `appName` 
SINCE 59 minutes ago 
LIMIT 1000

FROM ApplicationAgentContext 
SELECT uniqueCount(realAgentId) AS 'Number of Instances' 
SINCE last week 
FACET appName, appId
LIMIT max

FROM Transaction, TransactionError
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest'
SINCE 1 day ago

FROM Transaction, TransactionError
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
FACET appName 
SINCE 2 days ago
UNTIL 1 day ago
LIMIT 100 
TIMESERIES

widgets.title: Daily Ingest Estimate by App Name

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Transaction, TransactionError
SELECT rate(bytecountestimate()/1e9,1 day) AS 'GB Ingest' 
FACET appName 
LIMIT 1000

FROM Span, SpanEvent 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 1 day ago

FROM Span, SpanEvent 
SELECT bytecountestimate()/10e08 AS 'GB Ingest' 
FACET appName 
SINCE 2 days ago
UNTIL 1 day ago
LIMIT 100 
TIMESERIES

widgets.title: Daily Ingest Estimate by App Name

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Span, SpanEvent 
SELECT rate(bytecountestimate()/1e9,1 day) AS 'GB Ingest' 
FACET appName 
LIMIT 1000

rawConfiguration.text:
# A Note on Browser Data Ingest
At this time, the data ingest breakdown below does not include ingest related to Session Replay as it's not a queryable event. As a result, there may be a discrepancy between the estimated daily ingest below, which only accounts for the event data collected by the agent, and the total daily amount. 

The lower widgets provide a count of the unique session replays collected per application to identify the primary contributors to session replay-related ingest. You can then find the actual replay ingest by navigating to the Application Settings for a specific app and clicking "View your account's consumption" next to the "Session recording rules" header.

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM PageAction, JavaScriptError, PageView, AjaxRequest, PageViewTiming, BrowserInteraction, BrowserTiming, Ajax, BrowserSessionChunk, UserAction 
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 1 day ago

FROM PageAction, JavaScriptError, PageView, AjaxRequest, PageViewTiming, BrowserInteraction, BrowserTiming, Ajax, BrowserSessionChunk, UserAction 
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 2 days ago
UNTIL 1 day ago
FACET appName 
TIMESERIES 
LIMIT 100

widgets.title: Daily Ingest Estimate by App Name

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM PageAction, JavaScriptError, PageView, AjaxRequest, PageViewTiming, BrowserInteraction, BrowserTiming, Ajax, BrowserSessionChunk, UserAction 
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 AS 'GB Ingest'
FACET appName
SINCE 1 day ago
LIMIT 1000

widgets.title: Daily Ingest Estimate by Event Type

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM PageAction, JavaScriptError, PageView, AjaxRequest, PageViewTiming, BrowserInteraction, BrowserTiming, Ajax, BrowserSessionChunk, UserAction 
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 AS 'GB Ingest'
FACET eventType()
SINCE 1 day ago
LIMIT 1000

rawConfiguration.text:
# Notes on Infrastructure Telemetry

Infrastructure Host ingest only takes into account the raw data sent from the infrastructure agent. The raw data get aggregated into buckets to improve the query performance over longer periods of time. NRQL queries spanning less than one hour directly access the raw data, which is why most of the the below widgets are extrapolated to daily ingest based on the last 59 minutes. This is the most accurate way of estimating the bytes.

For trend analysis, please use the timeseries chart (to the right). You can use the timepicker to define the timeperiod you want to analyse. But be aware that query timeframes > 59 minutes will also take the aggregated telemetry into account.

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM SystemSample, NetworkSample, StorageSample
SELECT (bytecountestimate() / 1e9)/59 *60*24 AS 'GB Ingest'
SINCE 59 minutes ago

FROM SystemSample, NetworkSample, StorageSample
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest'
FACET hostname 
SINCE 1 day ago
TIMESERIES
LIMIT 100

FROM SystemSample, NetworkSample, StorageSample
SELECT (bytecountestimate() / 1e9)/59 *60*24 AS 'GB Ingest'
FACET hostname 
SINCE 59 minutes ago
LIMIT 1000

widgets.title: Daily Ingest Estimate by Event Type

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM SystemSample, NetworkSample, StorageSample
SELECT (bytecountestimate() / 1e9)/59 *60*24 AS 'GB Ingest'
FACET eventType() 
SINCE 59 minutes ago 
LIMIT 200

rawConfiguration.text:
# Notes on Infrastructure Telemetry

Infrastructure Host ingest only takes into account the raw data sent from the infrastructure agent. The raw data get aggregated into buckets to improve the query performance over longer periods of time. NRQL queries spanning less than one hour directly access the raw data, which is why most of the the below widgets are extrapolated to daily ingest based on the last 59 minutes. This is the most accurate way of estimating the bytes.

For trend analysis, please use the timeseries chart (to the right). You can use the timepicker to define the timeperiod you want to analyse. But be aware that query timeframes > 59 minutes will also take the aggregated telemetry into account.

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM ProcessSample 
SELECT (bytecountestimate() / 1e9)/59 *60*24 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 59 minutes ago

FROM ProcessSample 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 as 'InfraHostBytes GB Estimate'
FACET hostname 
SINCE 1 day ago 
TIMESERIES 
LIMIT 100

FROM ProcessSample 
SELECT (bytecountestimate() / 1e9)/59 *60*24 AS 'GB Ingest'
FACET hostname
SINCE 59 minutes ago
LIMIT 1000

FROM ProcessSample 
SELECT (bytecountestimate() / 1e9)/59 *60*24 AS 'GB Ingest'
FACET processDisplayName
SINCE 59 minutes ago
LIMIT 1000

FROM ProcessSample 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 as 'InfraHostBytes GB Estimate'
FACET processDisplayName 
SINCE 1 day ago 
TIMESERIES

rawConfiguration.text:
# Notes on Infrastructure Telemetry

Infrastructure Host ingest only takes into account the raw data sent from the infrastructure agent. The raw data get aggregated into buckets to improve the query performance over longer periods of time. NRQL queries spanning less than one hour directly access the raw data, which is why most of the the below widgets are extrapolated to daily ingest based on the last 59 minutes. This is the most accurate way of estimating the bytes.

For trend analysis, please use the timeseries chart (to the right). You can use the timepicker to define the timeperiod you want to analyse. But be aware that query timeframes > 59 minutes will also take the aggregated telemetry into account.

## Additional Note on Infrastructure Integrations
The specific tables required to analyze for this data breakdown depends on the infrastructure integrations in use. This can vary widely and could include 100+ tables in complex environments. By default, the widgets below look only at the possible tables related to our standard Kubernetes integration and infrastructure agent, but the list will need to be updated with the additional tables specific to your environment (e.g. AWS, Azure, MSSQL).

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM InfrastructureEvent, K8sHpaSample, K8sContainerSample, K8sJobSample, K8sVolumeSample, 
 InternalK8sCompositeSample, K8sEndpointSample, K8sReplicasetSample, 
 K8sNodeSample, K8sNamespaceSample, K8sStatefulsetSample,
 K8sCronjobSample, K8sDeploymentSample, K8sClusterSample, K8sPodSample,
 K8sPersistentVolumeSample, K8sPersistentVolumeClaimSample,
 K8sDaemonsetSample, K8sServiceSample
SELECT (bytecountestimate() / 1e9)/59 *60*24 as 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 59 minutes AGO

widgets.title: Daily Ingest Estimate by Event Type

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM InfrastructureEvent, K8sHpaSample, K8sContainerSample, K8sJobSample, K8sVolumeSample, 
 InternalK8sCompositeSample, K8sEndpointSample, K8sReplicasetSample, 
 K8sNodeSample, K8sNamespaceSample, K8sStatefulsetSample,
 K8sCronjobSample, K8sDeploymentSample, K8sClusterSample, K8sPodSample,
 K8sPersistentVolumeSample, K8sPersistentVolumeClaimSample,
 K8sDaemonsetSample, K8sServiceSample
SELECT (bytecountestimate() / 1e9)/59 *60*24 as 'GB Ingest' 
FACET eventType()
SINCE 59 minutes AGO

FROM InfrastructureEvent, K8sHpaSample, K8sContainerSample, K8sJobSample, K8sVolumeSample, 
 InternalK8sCompositeSample, K8sEndpointSample, K8sReplicasetSample, 
 K8sNodeSample, K8sNamespaceSample, K8sStatefulsetSample,
 K8sCronjobSample, K8sDeploymentSample, K8sClusterSample, K8sPodSample,
 K8sPersistentVolumeSample, K8sPersistentVolumeClaimSample,
 K8sDaemonsetSample, K8sServiceSample
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 as 'GB Ingest' 
FACET eventType()
SINCE 1 day AGO
TIMESERIES

FROM K8sHpaSample, K8sContainerSample, K8sJobSample, K8sVolumeSample, 
 InternalK8sCompositeSample, K8sEndpointSample, K8sReplicasetSample, 
 K8sNodeSample, K8sNamespaceSample, K8sStatefulsetSample,
 K8sCronjobSample, K8sDeploymentSample, K8sClusterSample, K8sPodSample,
 K8sPersistentVolumeSample, K8sPersistentVolumeClaimSample,
 K8sDaemonsetSample, K8sServiceSample
SELECT (bytecountestimate() / 1e9)/59 *60*24 as 'GB Ingest'
FACET clusterName
SINCE 59 minutes AGO
LIMIT 1000

FROM K8sHpaSample, K8sContainerSample, K8sJobSample, K8sVolumeSample, 
 InternalK8sCompositeSample, K8sEndpointSample, K8sReplicasetSample, 
 K8sNodeSample, K8sNamespaceSample, K8sStatefulsetSample,
 K8sCronjobSample, K8sDeploymentSample, K8sClusterSample, K8sPodSample,
 K8sPersistentVolumeSample, K8sPersistentVolumeClaimSample,
 K8sDaemonsetSample, K8sServiceSample
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 as 'GB Ingest'
FACET clusterName
SINCE 1 day AGO
TIMESERIES
LIMIT 100

widgets.title: Daily Ingest Estimate by K8s Event

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM K8sHpaSample, K8sContainerSample, K8sJobSample, K8sVolumeSample, 
 InternalK8sCompositeSample, K8sEndpointSample, K8sReplicasetSample, 
 K8sNodeSample, K8sNamespaceSample, K8sStatefulsetSample,
 K8sCronjobSample, K8sDeploymentSample, K8sClusterSample, K8sPodSample,
 K8sPersistentVolumeSample, K8sPersistentVolumeClaimSample,
 K8sDaemonsetSample, K8sServiceSample
SELECT (bytecountestimate() / 1e9)/59 *60*24 as 'GB Ingest'
FACET eventType()
SINCE 59 minutes AGO
LIMIT 1000

FROM K8sHpaSample, K8sContainerSample, K8sJobSample, K8sVolumeSample, 
 InternalK8sCompositeSample, K8sEndpointSample, K8sReplicasetSample, 
 K8sNodeSample, K8sNamespaceSample, K8sStatefulsetSample,
 K8sCronjobSample, K8sDeploymentSample, K8sClusterSample, K8sPodSample,
 K8sPersistentVolumeSample, K8sPersistentVolumeClaimSample,
 K8sDaemonsetSample, K8sServiceSample
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 as 'GB Ingest'
FACET eventtype()
SINCE 1 day AGO
TIMESERIES
LIMIT 100

FROM Log 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 1 day ago

WITH if(entity.name is not null, entity.name, if(hostname is not null, hostname, 'No entity linked')) as entity
FROM Log 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Estimate'
FACET entity
SINCE 2 day ago 
UNTIL 1 day ago
TIMESERIES 
LIMIT 100

WITH if(entity.name is not null, entity.name, if(hostname is not null, hostname, 'No entity linked')) as entity
FROM Log 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Estimate'
FACET entity
SINCE 1 day ago 
LIMIT 1000

FROM ServiceLevelSnapshot
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest'
SINCE 1 day ago

FROM Indexing 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 2 day ago
UNTIL 1 day ago
FACET entity.name
TIMESERIES 
LIMIT 100

FROM ServiceLevelSnapshot 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 1 day ago
FACET entity.name
LIMIT 1000

FROM WorkloadStatus
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest'
SINCE 1 day ago

FROM WorkloadStatus 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 2 day ago
UNTIL 1 day ago
FACET entity.name
TIMESERIES 
LIMIT 100

FROM WorkloadStatus 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 1 day ago
FACET entity.name
LIMIT 1000

FROM Mobile, MobileActivityTrace, MobileBreadcrumb, MobileCrash, MobileHandledException, MobileRequest, MobileRequestError, MobileSession, MobileUserAction
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest'
SINCE 1 day ago

FROM Mobile, MobileActivityTrace, MobileBreadcrumb, MobileCrash, MobileHandledException, MobileRequest, MobileRequestError, MobileSession, MobileUserAction
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
FACET device_name
SINCE 2 day ago
UNTIL 1 day ago
LIMIT 100 
TIMESERIES

widgets.title: Daily Ingest Estimate by Flow Device

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Mobile, MobileActivityTrace, MobileBreadcrumb, MobileCrash, MobileHandledException, MobileRequest, MobileRequestError, MobileSession, MobileUserAction  
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
FACET device_name
SINCE 1 day ago
LIMIT 1000

FROM KFlow
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest'
SINCE 1 day ago

FROM KFlow
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
FACET device_name
SINCE 2 day ago
UNTIL 1 day ago
LIMIT 100 
TIMESERIES

widgets.title: Daily Ingest Estimate by Flow Device

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM KFlow  
SELECT bytecountestimate()/1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
FACET device_name
SINCE 1 day ago
LIMIT 1000

rawConfiguration.text:
# Note on Custom Events
The specific tables required to analyze for this data breakdown depends on the custom events being sent to the New Relic platform. The queries below contain a placeholder event table, ```Indexing```, that should be replaced with a comma-delimited list of your custom tables in the NRDB.

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Indexing 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 1 day ago

FROM Indexing 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 2 day ago
UNTIL 1 day ago
FACET eventType()
TIMESERIES 
LIMIT 100

widgets.title: Daily Ingest Estimate by Event Type

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Indexing 
SELECT bytecountestimate() / 1e9 AS 'GB Ingest' 
SINCE 1 day ago
FACET eventType()
LIMIT 1000
